meanings.definition: A feeling of nervousness or unease.
meanings.sent1: The student felt a jitter before giving a presentation in class.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't shake off the jitter she felt before the job interview.
meanings.sent3: His jitter about the upcoming test made him study extra hard.
meanings.sent4: The jitter in her stomach felt like a swarm of butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The jitter in the room was palpable as they awaited the results.

meanings.sent1: The jitter of the squirrel's tail caught the attention of the curious child.
meanings.sent2: The jitter of the leaves in the wind created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent3: The jitter of the toy car made it seem alive to the child.
meanings.sent4: The jitter of the water droplets on the leaf resembled a tiny dance.
meanings.sent5: The jitter of the rabbit's nose twitched as it sniffed the air.
